replies.body:
Dont start with any comments like "OCN is better" or "Avicus is better".

Ill point this out "This has been brought up several times and this will not be happening." ~ParaSpider

IF the tournament happens there should be staff organising. On overcast theres event coordinators that organise overcast events and they could probably work something out with avicus staff.

Reasons why I would not want this happening:
 - Servers - Who would host the event?
 - Maps - Selection of maps would have to be from OCN and avicus but in the final, it will come down to 1 map
 - Players - Lets say we have 8 teams (4 OCN, Avicus). Selecting those 80 players from both networks would be hard AND if OCN wins first four matches (example) then Avicus is already out.
 - Map knowlage - I dont know about Avicus but on OCN a lot of stuff depends on map knowlage. It would be really important.

Overall I just see too many negative things and issues that could appear.

 - Let's say Avicus loses (example). When some younger kids know there will be spam all over OCN's forum. 

Something like this would be cool to do but looking at the things I pointed out above I highly doubt it would be worth doing.

My opinion on the whole thing in a shorter version: It would be cool, but the amount of preparing is too big and not worth doing.
replies.body_tagged:

IF the tournament happens there should be staff organising. On overcast theres event coordinators that organise overcast events and they could probably work something out with avicus staff.

Reasons why I would not want this happening:
 - Servers - Who would host the event?
 - Maps - Selection of maps would have to be from OCN and avicus but in the final, it will come down to 1 map
 - Players - Lets say we have 8 teams (4 OCN, Avicus). Selecting those 80 players from both networks would be hard AND if OCN wins first four matches (example) then Avicus is already out.
 - Map knowlage - I dont know about Avicus but on OCN a lot of stuff depends on map knowlage. It would be really important.

Overall I just see too many negative things and issues that could appear.

 - Let's say Avicus loses (example). When some younger kids know there will be spam all over OCN's forum. 

Something like this would be cool to do but looking at the things I pointed out above I highly doubt it would be worth doing.

My opinion on the whole thing in a shorter version: It would be cool, but the amount of preparing is too big and not worth doing.

replies.body:
I have a better idea. Make it an unofficial tournament, one that players from both servers host. 
Either 32 teams from both servers can play or 16 teams. Put it into a randomiser for choosing who plays who. I would advice against putting OCN and Avicus at round 1 because it would make people upset. 
Instead of Avicus vs OCN it should be Avicus and OCN. This shows that it isn't a tournament to see who is the best but a joined one to bring both parties together.

I am sure staff would help out, it is just those with the final decision saying no. I would quite happily help out and try and get it organised. I have no issue with it, but a joint effort would bring the community closer together.
It is really just organising the whole tournament what seems to be more difficult than it actually seems to be.
